name: Crescent Street B
description: Crescent Street B is a worn residential street marked by neglect and quiet tension. Old houses, uneven pavement, and aging municipal infrastructure give the impression of a place long ignored by the town’s authorities. Though seemingly ordinary, the street subtly connects several critical locations tied to the investigation.

snapshot.name: Crescent Street B
snapshot.description: The street is lined with aging houses and dim, unreliable streetlights. Cracks in the pavement reveal repeated repairs, and the air often carries a faint damp smell from underground utilities. Residents keep to themselves, avoiding unnecessary attention. At night, the street feels especially oppressive, as if something beneath the surface is active but unseen.

conditions.description: Streetlights flicker intermittently, leaving long stretches in partial darkness.
A faint, persistent odor of dampness and sewage lingers near certain sections of the street.

exits.description: A weathered two-story wooden house set slightly back from the street, appearing poorly maintained and unusually isolated.
Sewer access points concealed within the street, blending into the damaged pavement.
Bruno’s vehicle parked along the street, used during the investigation and serving as a temporary point of mobility.(The car only appears after 12.26,with Bruno's dead body found in the car)
Leads back toward Crescent Street A.
Continues toward other residential areas of Cassandra.

snapshot.keeperNotes: Crescent Street B is best used as a connective and transitional environment. While it offers few immediate clues, its exits link to several high-impact locations. Emphasize unease, neglect, and the sense that the street itself is quietly complicit in the town’s secrets.

connections.description: Connected streets forming part of the same residential and official boundary zone.
Crescent Street B transitions into Crescent Street C within the residential district.
